title: Why am I not able to get good Tamil articles in web? Does it mean no one interested in reading Tamil articles? - Quora

response.answer_text: While most regular readers would agree that the content of Tamil newspapers and magazines has leaned more towards cinema and sensational stuff in recent years as cited in the question, I am afraid I do not agree with the contention that the quality of writers or writing itself has declined. In my opinion, some of the popular magazines still publish quality content though definitely less compared to what was the situation 5-10 years back. Coming to the question of web presence, I started reading Tamil articles online a couple of years back and personally for me, the experience has been very positive. Websites that publish Tamil articles have become really active portals of knowledge sharing and discussion on a variety of topics. I will share some sites that I have come across. Please note that this is not an exhaustive list. Also the content and themes of these sites may not suit everyone's tastes, but I am mentioning them here because these are some of the most popular sites today, and exploring the articles and discussions on these sites can actually lead you to some more sites that you might be interested in. Popular sites of individuals and sites for current affairs: 1. IdlyVadai - இட்லிவடை : Popular site for Politics and Current affairs with a touch of humour. 2. கலகக்குரல் 3. பத்ரி சேஷாத்ரி 4. யுவகிருஷ்ணா Popular web magazines: 1. தமிழ் பேப்பர் : Web journal with articles on a almost every topic under the sun. Politics, Cinema, Self-improvement, Literature, History, Law etc., 2. தமிழின் முதல் இணைய வாரப்பத்திரிகை: According to their website it is the first Tamil web weekly magazine. You have a lot of articles on a variety of topics here too. 3. சவுக்கு Finally, if you are looking for professional writers: 1. எழுத்தாளர் ஜெயமோகன் : One of the most acclaimed and renown writer/thinker in the field today. Though he is not very popular among the common masses, he is a highly respected writer in literary circles. Some might know him from his association with the South Indian movie industry in recent times as the co-writer of Naan Kadavul (2009 movie based on his novel Yezhaam Ulagam), and Kadal (upcoming Mani Ratnam movie) and as the writer of the recent critically acclaimed Malayalam movie Ozhimuri. 2. Welcome to Sramakrishnan3. வண்ணதாசன்4. நாஞ்சில்நாடன் All the above are well-known and prominent Tamil writers of today and you can find their writings in these sites. I am sure there are still a lot more websites that are popular and really good that I might have missed out, but these sites can be a good starting point. Happy Reading!
